etymology.description: 大 (great) + 力 (strength) + 士 (person) = person of great strength (strongman).
etymology.interpretation: Denotes a person characterized by exceptional physical power, akin to a strongman. 士 serves as a noun-forming suffix meaning 'person'.

examples.chinese: 他是村里的大力士(他是村裡的大力士)，能举起很重的石头(能舉起很重的石頭)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì cūn lǐ de dàlìshì, néng jǔ qǐ hěn zhòng de shítou.
examples.english: He is the village strongman and can lift very heavy stones.

examples.chinese: 在杂技表演中(在雜技表演中)，大力士展示惊人的臂力(大力士展示驚人的臂力)。
examples.pinyin: Zài zájì biǎoyǎn zhōng, dàlìshì zhǎnshì jīngrén de bìlì.
examples.english: In acrobatic shows, the strongman displays astonishing arm strength.

examples.chinese: 他从小就练习举重(他從小就練習舉重)，梦想成为世界级的大力士(夢想成為世界級的大力士)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng xiǎo jiù liànxí jǔzhòng, mèngxiǎng chéngwéi shìjiè jí de dàlìshì.
examples.english: Since childhood he has practiced weightlifting, dreaming of becoming a world-class strongman.
